text:
Brett Lorenzo Favre is a former American football quarterback who played in the National Football League (NFL) for 20 seasons. He is most famous for his time with the Green Bay Packers, where he won a Super Bowl and three NFL MVP awards.

Favre was born on October 10, 1969, in Gulfport, Mississippi. He grew up in Kiln, Mississippi, and played football, basketball, and baseball at Hancock North Central High School. He was a multi-sport star, leading his high school team to a state championship in football and setting a state record for career passing yards.

Favre played college football at the University of Southern Mississippi, where he set numerous records and led the team to a bowl game in 1988. The Atlanta Falcons selected him in the second round of the 1991 NFL Draft, but he was traded to the Green Bay Packers on draft day.

Favre's NFL career was marked by his toughness, accuracy, and ability to perform under pressure. He won the NFL MVP award three times (1995, 1996, and 1997) and led the Packers to a Super Bowl XXXI victory in 1997. He also set numerous franchise and league records, including the most career passing yards (71,838) and touchdowns (508) in NFL history.

Favre played for the Packers from 1992 to 2007, becoming the team's all-time leader in passing yards and touchdowns. He was traded to the New York Jets in 2008, but was released after one season. He then signed with the Minnesota Vikings, leading the team to the NFC Championship Game in 2009.

Favre retired from the NFL in 2011, holding the record for most career starts (302) and most consecutive starts (297) at the time. He was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2016, in his first year of eligibility.

Favre has been involved in various charity and business ventures since his retirement. He founded the Favre Four Quarter Foundation, which supports charities and provides scholarships to underprivileged children. He has also been involved in various entrepreneurial ventures, including a wine label and a chain of restaurants.

Despite his many accolades and achievements, Favre is perhaps most famous for his record-breaking streak of consecutive starts (297) and his iconic " Favreism" – a term coined by fans to describe his tendency to make clutch plays and lead his team to come-from-behind victories.
